list_definition.mean_english: nhún vai biểu thị sự nghi ngờ
list_definition.definition: to show doubt, lack of interest etc by raising (the shoulders)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: When I asked him if he knew what had happened, he just shrugged (his shoulders).
She gave a shrug of disbelief.

list_ex_of_english: I do not think that this is to be shrugged off as insignificant.
What about the countries that are only now shrugging off the shackles of the past?
The inevitable effect on industrial costs and exports is shrugged off.
We have no intention of shrugging off our responsibilities.
Continual talk of perpetuating divisions only damages a great industry that is shrugging off a disastrous political strike.
As the broadcast industry matured, it shrugged off that lack of sophistication.
However, it is not true to say that regulations which are shrugged off by large companies are not a burden on smaller companies.
I do not believe that this is something which can be shrugged off.
